A smartphone with a built-in virtual reality headset: This smartphone would have a detachable headset that allows users to enter virtual reality environments and interact with them using hand gestures. The phone would have a high-resolution display and a powerful processor to ensure smooth performance. This would be a game-changer for mobile gaming and entertainment.

A smartphone with a modular design: This smartphone would have a removable back panel that allows users to swap out different modules based on their needs. For example, users could add a camera module for better photography, a battery module for longer battery life, or a wireless charging module for convenience.

A smartphone with a flexible screen: This smartphone would have a screen that can bend and fold in half, allowing users to view content in either portrait or landscape mode. The screen would be made of a flexible OLED material that can withstand bending without breaking.

A smartphone with a built-in AI assistant: This smartphone would have an AI assistant that can learn from the user's habits and preferences, and provide personalized recommendations and suggestions. The assistant would be integrated into the phone's operating system, allowing it to work seamlessly with all apps and services.

A smartphone with a built-in solar panel: This smartphone would have a solar panel on the back that allows users to charge the phone using sunlight. The panel would be small enough to fit on a smartphone, but powerful enough to provide a full charge in a few hours. This would be a great solution for people who are always on the go and don't have access to power outlets.
